templates.name: Store location / retailer
templates.content: We don't currently have a store but definitely keep an eye out!

templates.content: Give us a follow on https://www.instagram.com/AllPosters/: link and FB here: https://www.facebook.com/AllPosters

templates.name: What's the difference between a Poster and an Art Print?
templates.content: Typically, the art print is printed on a higher grade of paper so it is thicker and often provides more texture.

templates.name: How is my order packaged?
templates.content:
The quality of your shipment is our priority and the materials we use to package our products reflect our commitment:
Rest assured, if your order contains a combination of these items, they will ship separately in the appropriate packaging, and you will not be charged additional shipping.

- Posters and Art Prints:
- Rolled with protective wrapping paper and packaged in a cardboard tube.
- Glossy Photos and Photo Cards: Packaged and protected in a flat 23 cm x 30 cm standard cardboard envelope.
- Canvas, Mounted Items and Framed Items:
- Covered with protective wrap and packaged in a durable cardboard box.
- Gift Packaging

templates.name: Shipping time
templates.content:
Processing of in-stock posters, prints, and photographs takes 24 hours. Once shipped, it will take 1-3 days to arrive. 
You can check more about Order Processing & Delivery Expectations here: https://www.allposters.com/help/shipping

templates.name: Return Policy
templates.content: You can check out our detailed return policy here: https://www.allposters.com/help/shipping#:~:text=currency%20exchange%20rates.-,Return%20policy,-Dometic%20orders%3A%20within

templates.name: Why are some Art Prints more expensive than others?
templates.content:
Most of the more expensive Art Prints, if they are not oversized, maybe one or a combination of the following:

- Signed by the artist: The artist's signature appears on the print.
- Limited edition: The publisher or artist has released a limited amount of each print.
- Serigraph: An Art Print that is printed through a silkscreen stencil. Each color requires a separate stencil and is printed with higher-quality ink.
-  Lithograph: An Art Print that has been produced by the process of putting designs or writing with a greasy material on stone, from which printed impressions are produced.

templates.name: Order status/order tracking
templates.content: You can use our convenient online tool to see the latest updates on your order: https://www.allposters.com/ADC.Net/Root/Pages/Tracking/OrderTracking.aspx

templates.name: What does it mean when my order says "Processing"?
templates.content:
It means several things. We are processing your order for payment authorization; our warehouse staff is batching, picking and packing your order for shipment to you; or your order is being "staged" while we wait for an item to arrive so we can process your shipment.
You can refer to our Shipping Rate Calculator to view order processing and delivery times for your order: https://www.allposters.com/help/shipping

templates.name: What's an original movie poster & a double-sided movie poster?
templates.content: Generally, original movie posters have a limited print run and are only available for a short time. Original movie posters are often double-sided-with a mirror image of the print on each side.

templates.name: Phone support
templates.content: You can give us a call at 1-888-654-0143. We're available Monday through Friday, from 9 AM to 6 PM EST, or let me know if I can help via text, it may be faster.

templates.name: What is priority processing?
templates.content: You will receive priority processing if you select Expedited or Overnight shipping during checkout. This means that your order will move to the front of the line to be handled immediately. Depending on the item(s) you order, this can reduce your processing time by up to 3 days, thus allowing your package to be shipped out faster.

templates.name: Why can't I frame certain posters or prints I find on your site?
templates.content:
The print or the combination of print, cropping, matting, and molding is too big to frame. We can only frame combinations when the largest side is less than 114 centimeters and the smaller side is less than 89 centimeters.
You can try to reduce the size by:
- Cropping the print
- Removing mats
- Choosing a smaller molding
- Selecting from our Oversized Mats

templates.name: This is a gift, can I add a gift card & what if the package won't arrive in time?
templates.content: During checkout, you can indicate your order is a gift and write your own personal gift message. Your message will be printed on the packing slip and we will not include any prices on the packing slip. Additionally, you can use our free E-cards. Simply find the image on our Web site and click on the "Send This Image as Free E-Card" link. You can use this free service to notify the recipient that the gift is on its way.

templates.name: Do you ship internationally?
templates.content: Outside of the United States, we ship only to Canada. At-will return shipping costs are the responsibility of the purchaser. All international orders may be subject to import duties and taxes assessed by local governments and are due upon delivery. This is not included in the order total. All prices shown are in US dollars and are subject to currency exchange rates.

templates.name: Free shipping
templates.content: We don't currently offer free shipping, but all promos will always be shared with our SMS subscribers or on our website, so keep an eye out!

templates.name: Cancel / edit order
templates.content:
The best way to handle this is to email us directly at Orders@allposters.com or give us a call at 1-888-654-0143. We're available Monday through Friday, from 9 AM to 6 PM EST.
Our team is happy to help!

templates.name: What payment methods do you accept?
templates.content: We accept payment by credit card (Visa, MasterCard, Discovery, and Amex) and PayPal.

Our team is happy to help!
